title: Tuza's Conjecture for Random Graphs
main_result: Tuza holds asymptotically almost surely for G(n,p)

lemmas.name: tuza_random_gnp
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_random_gnp : ∀ p : ℕ → ℝ, Probability(G(n,p(n)) satisfies Tuza) → 1 as n → ∞
lemmas.english: Random graphs G(n,p) satisfy Tuza with probability approaching 1

lemmas.name: tuza_random_all_densities
lemmas.statement: Result holds for all edge probability functions p = p(n)
lemmas.english: Works for sparse, dense, and all intermediate regimes

bennett_cushman_dudek2021.title: Closing the Random Graph Gap in Tuza's Conjecture
bennett_cushman_dudek2021.result: Same result, independent proof via online triangle packing

key_insight: Random graphs satisfy Tuza a.a.s. Any counterexample must be structured/adversarial, not random.
implications_for_nu4: Cannot find counterexample by random search
notes: Probabilistic result - may not be directly usable in Lean proof but constrains search
